articles.headline: E.U. Rules Look to Unify Digital Market, but U.S. Sees Protectionism
articles.snippet: The rules will put new pressure on American tech companies, but European officials say they will unite the Continent’s various national economies.
articles.abstract: The rules will put new pressure on American tech companies, but European officials say they will unite the Continent’s various national economies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google may have to pay publishers for their content. Facebook might, too. WhatsApp could have to follow tougher telecom standards.

articles.headline: America’s Inequality Problem: Real Income Gains Are Brief and Hard to Find
articles.snippet: It is becoming more difficult for the poor and middle class to get ahead. But it’s a different story for the rich, whose gains are accelerating.
articles.abstract: It is becoming more difficult for the poor and middle class to get ahead. But it’s a different story for the rich, whose gains are accelerating.
articles.lead_paragraph: Working families finally got a raise.

articles.headline: The Economic Expansion Is Helping the Middle Class, Finally
articles.snippet: However you measure it (and there are lots of ways), the news on wages is good, though it could still be better.
articles.abstract: However you measure it (and there are lots of ways), the news on wages is good, though it could still be better.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, the standard knock on this economic expansion has been twofold: Growth has been slow, and big businesses and wealthy investors have been its major beneficiaries, rather than middle-class wage earners.

articles.headline: How a Dutch Businessman Fulfilled His Dream to Open a ‘World-Class’ Museum
articles.snippet: The former chemical company executive Joop van Caldenborgh has created the Voorlinden, a museum in the Netherlands founded on several thousand works of art.
articles.abstract: The former chemical company executive Joop van Caldenborgh has created the Voorlinden, a museum in the Netherlands founded on several thousand works of art.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASSENAAR, the Netherlands — The Dutch chemical company executive and art collector Joop van Caldenborgh was attending a dinner in London in the 1990s when the American abstract artist Ellsworth Kelly approached him.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Unveils Plan for Families in Bid for Women’s Votes
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s call for six weeks of mandatory paid maternity leave and expanded tax credits for child care is another attempt to court elusive support from women.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s call for six weeks of mandatory paid maternity leave and expanded tax credits for child care is another attempt to court elusive support from women.
articles.lead_paragraph: ASTON, Pa. — Donald J. Trump unveiled a menu of proposals on Tuesday to help working parents, calling for six weeks of mandatory paid maternity leave and expanded tax credits for child care.
articles.byline: By Nick Corasaniti and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Fast Response to ‘Brexit’ News: A Pop-Up Paper Finds Success in Britain
articles.snippet: The New European was conceived as a short-term weekly offering in the wake of Britain’s vote to leave the European Union, but it has been a surprise success.
articles.abstract: The New European was conceived as a short-term weekly offering in the wake of Britain’s vote to leave the European Union, but it has been a surprise success.
articles.lead_paragraph: The morning after Britain voted to leave the European Union, Matt Kelly ducked into a coffee shop on a graffiti-lined street in the trendy East London neighborhood of Shoreditch.

articles.headline: In Expanding Russian Influence, Faith Combines With Firepower
articles.snippet: The Russian Orthodox Church helps spread President Vladimir V. Putin’s gospel of illiberal democracy and traditional values, pushing into resolutely secular members of Europe like France.
articles.abstract: The Russian Orthodox Church helps spread President Vladimir V. Putin’s gospel of illiberal democracy and traditional values, pushing into resolutely secular members of Europe like France.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The golden main dome of a new Russian Orthodox cathedral now under construction on the banks of the Seine shimmers in the sun, towering over a Paris neighborhood studded with government buildings and foreign embassies. Most sensitive of all, it is being built beside a 19th-century palace that has been used to conceal some of the French presidency’s most closely guarded secrets.

articles.headline: Details of Syria Pact Widen Rift Between John Kerry and Pentagon
articles.snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton Carter opposed the plan for U.S. and Russian military collaboration against ISIS, which Secretary of State John Kerry supports.
articles.abstract: Defense Secretary Ashton Carter opposed the plan for U.S. and Russian military collaboration against ISIS, which Secretary of State John Kerry supports.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The agreement that Secretary of State John Kerry announced with Russia to reduce the killing in Syria has widened an increasingly public divide between Mr. Kerry and Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter, who has deep reservations about the plan for American and Russian forces to jointly target terrorist groups.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: How Did G.M. Create Tesla’s Dream Car First?
articles.snippet: The Bolt EV by General Motors is a lower-priced electric car than the Tesla, and has similar features.
articles.abstract: The Bolt EV by General Motors is a lower-priced electric car than the Tesla, and has similar features.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORION TOWNSHIP, Mich. — Ten years ago, a little-known tech entrepreneur named Elon Musk published a secret master plan for Tesla Motors, an ambitious electric car start-up he had funded.

articles.headline: What It Feels Like to Ride in a Self-Driving Uber
articles.snippet: Uber is starting its driverless car pilot program in Pittsburgh on Wednesday with a small fleet of modified Ford Fusions.
articles.abstract: Uber is starting its driverless car pilot program in Pittsburgh on Wednesday with a small fleet of modified Ford Fusions.
articles.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH — I’m parked on a patch of gravel outside the old Heinz ketchup bottling factory here early on a Monday morning, and I’m frustrated. My Uber self-driving car will not start driving itself.

articles.headline: Bayer Deal for Monsanto Follows Agribusiness Trend, Raising Worries for Farmers
articles.snippet: Bayer will acquire Monsanto for $128 a share in cash in a deal that is among the largest German corporate takeovers of an American company.
articles.abstract: Bayer will acquire Monsanto for $128 a share in cash in a deal that is among the largest German corporate takeovers of an American company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Don Halcomb, a 63-year-old farmer in Adairville, Ky., is expecting his profit to vanish this year, largely because of the confluence of falling crop prices and rising costs for seeds and other materials.
articles.byline: By Leslie Picker, Danny Hakim and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Colin Powell, in Hacked Emails, Shows Scorn for Trump and Irritation at Clinton
articles.snippet: The disclosures ripped away the diplomatic jargon and political niceties of a former secretary of state with a sober, thoughtful reputation.
articles.abstract: The disclosures ripped away the diplomatic jargon and political niceties of a former secretary of state with a sober, thoughtful reputation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Former Secretary of State Colin L. Powell has long been one of the high priests of the Washington establishment, staying quiet in this year’s raucous presidential campaign while tending to his reputation as a thoughtful officer and diplomat.
